review_blob: Bottle 330 cc.  I had some fear when seeing that the contents in the bottle is very turbid (not the style). I thought it would be another bad Beer. Pouring on the glass, presents a golden ocher, slightly cloudy. The foam is very good, fair (not much, not too little). The aroma is spectacular, although the candy sweetness dominates, we can see some malt and some hops. Very balanced. Now the best. In the mouth, feels soft and strongly penetrating hop bitterness, while perhaps gets a little spicy on the palate. Drink another sip, and do not quite convince me of the good that is. Congratulations, its a very good pale ale.

I am writing this after having tasted this beer many times. Dark brown, with a very creamy head that goes fast though, thats fine.
On the nose hops dominate all you can imagine. This undoubtedly has to do with cannabis, maybe some eucalyptus, and a little lemon.
Nevertheless, I can see the barley and cereals. This is wonderful. Finally a good beer that does not have that sticky sweetness of microbrews. I repeat, a great Chilean.

Bottle 750ml. Bought in Malloco 2010. Has a black deep color, with a just head and durable. The aroma is of an incredible depth of brown malt. This beer is very complete, strong and robust, his complexity departs from the coffee and ends in the chocolate, with a perfect and slow transition. A marvel!. The strength balances with a solid body, where the sweetness balances with a not very deep bitterness. This beer made me have hope, undoubtedly the best Chilean stout that I have proved.

Flows of gold and cloudily yellow, with a gray head. Aroma well hoppy, with something of caramel. The flavor is to fruits, a slight candy malty. Flavors to fruit and to yeast, also the slight caramel. Agreeable Hoppy, and also the sweet malt. A bit alcoholic in the end, but well.

Has a color dark brown, mahogany and reddish. The head is dense and very lasting. The aroma is to cereals, with a bit of vanilla and banana. The flavor is sweet enough, and incredibly it knows to banana. There is something of bitterness and a very subtle touch of malty, but it is earthy. It leaves an aftertaste that first is sweet and then almost astringent. The body is dense enough, but not since it should be a weizen. It is a slight beer, with a touch of masses and banana. Better than many(very) other beers of  microbreweries of Chile.

Has a color amber and many bubbles. The head is almost white, though with a lasting enough cord. The aroma is slight, though some sweet fruits are perceived and for supposed the caramel. The flavor is soft, too much. Something of yeast hidden behind a thin hop. Something of small peaches and very few malt. The body is very thin. A refreshing, soft beer, without many pretension.

Has a dark red color, with lights ruby color. The aroma is toasted, malty. The flavor is quite good, is strong the flavor to toffe of Malt. Has one slight bitterness, but the fruits predominate, until the end. She is light, with very little body. Balanced beer, that drinks well.

Has a golden, but dark color, with a cloudy aspect. The aroma is well hoppy, though there is presence of small peaches and dried fruits. The flavor is penetrating for the caramel. The bitterness is small (in spite of his label that Pilsner says). This beer more near the Ale, that of the Pilsner. Has a rather slight, silky and soft body. Really i not as describes this beer, it is not an Ale and is not a Pilsner. Rare.

Has a dark black color, with a yellowish, very abundant and lasting head. The aroma is toasted, sweet coffee, by some touches of chocolate. The flavor is a plenary session of coffee, with some touches of caramel. The hop this one in his measured joust, being mixed softly with an end of slight yeast. Has a great body, with a creamy and thick texture. Really I have been surprised. It is a spectacular beer.

Has a dark brown color, with some reddish touch. Small, rapid enough and effervescent head. The aroma is of yeast and masses, loudly enough. The flavor is wrong, an excess of caramel and yeast. Astringent. Thin and watery body. No more commentaries.

Has an orange color, similar to the copper. With a minimal and very rapid head. This beer is full of gas. The aroma is sweet, where it predominates over the caramel. The flavor is of an acid candy, with some touches of malty, but with a tart finish. Has a weak, very watery body. Very basic beer.

Has a black deep color, with a color coffee head, very minimal and very rapid. The aroma is agreeable, a coffee and something smoked. The taste is strong, predominates over the coffee, with some touches malty, toasted, and an finish with a touch of sweet. The body is weak and thin, the consistency is a bit watery. In general well. Chileans Stouts good attempt.

A color has orange/amber, very turbid and cloudy. With a thick and white head. The aroma is floral. In the palate it is very of fruits, pear and apples, with some touches of mass. Also there are small peaches by the finish, which is of a soft sweetness. Very good beer.

Has a dark black color and a great head, abundant and frothy. The aroma is unmistakable, of black chocolate. The flavor is with the brown chocolate, but the finish is dry and a bit bitter, maybe too much. But, is a excellent stout.

Has a black good color, with a foam, not very abundant, of color beige. The aroma is very good, remembers a sweet coffee with mocha. The flavor is penetrating, the roasted coffee stands out, to finish in an aftertaste toasted with a subtle touch of sweet. The bitterness is precise. Excellent. I believe that it is of the best Chilean stout.

Has a color clear amber, and has a frothy, very abundant head, of a color beige clearly. The aroma is to fruits, maybe figs. The taste is fine, with a slight bitterness, well. Nevertheless, the caramel has reputation too much. (Typical of the Chilean microbreweries). Has a very light body, is watery enough and alcoholic. It is a decent Ale.

Has a dark, almost black color. The aroma is good, a chocolate and coffee, also with something of mocka. The flavor is good enough, there are distinguished the candy, the malt and some dried fruits. In the palate is soft, there is very much caramel and something of coffee, ultimately one I stop of bitter chocolate, reminds a "foundi" of chocolate. This beer is something agreeable of taking, but without any special thing, well.

Color has amber, cloudily, very turbid. Has a white and yellowish, average and slightly persistent head. The aroma is enough malty, with something of masses and smell of dampness. In the palate there are well-known the sweet caramel and the malt, which continues being strong. Fact of less the bitterness, which is very small. A regular beer, without anything special

Has a reddish color, almost mahogany. This flood of bubbles. Has very little foam, very fast white and. The aroma is too strong, the cinnamon is very penetrating. The flavor, single in the principle is showy, but immediately is disagreeable. This is not a beer!. Another beer that commits the error to contain an aggregate too much. Too much cinnamon, too much. Very badly
beer_name: Volcanes del Sur Premium Red Lager

review_blob: In the caf vinilo pub, in a bottle without label. Has a dark brown color. The aroma is enough malty, roasted coffee. The flavor has insinuations of coffee, but is tart. The caramel is not sufficient to hide the final acid. Deficient

Has a dark gilding, with a white and abundant foam. The aroma is sweet, with candy and some fruit-bearing notes. In the palate the sweet of the caramel is perceived, and very finely, some insinuations of spices that I do not achieve to identify. The body is average and effervescent. There is probably something in the water of this beer, an unknown flavor. A very good attempt of beer.

Note: "Kol", in the Mapuche language (Mapudungun), means brown color. This beer corresponds to a brown ale.
Has a soft aroma, masses and enough malty. The color is an amber, brilliant, slightly cloudily. has an abundant foam beige. In the palate, it is enough hoppy, with good aftertaste, where the caramel and the malt is perceived by clarity. The body is weak and thin, nevertheless, I believe that it is a very good beer. Congratulations.

Color dark, cloudy amber. Almost without foam. Has little aroma, but some coffee and candy is insinuated. This that I drink is very thin, without body. This is a water with flavor. Nothing of body. This has very small of beer, is a refreshing beverage, and as such is not bad.
Has a golden dark and dimmed color. Very little aroma (masses). The flavor has something of fruits and citruses, are sharp and bitter in the finish. Very badly. I cannot finish the bottle.

Has a golden dark color, with a head small and lasting enough. The aroma is strong and sweet, almonds and sweet candy. The flavor is very strong, very malty, but at the same time sweet. Has a bit of bitterness, which one hides behind the caramel. The finish is very sweet and alcoholic. Is sticky and deep, almost it does not look like a beer.

Has a brown, very dark color, and a very minimal and rapid head. The aroma is deep, good, is like to be in forest of pines. The flavor is very complex, there is berries and sweet caramel, also something of sweet malt. There is bitter chocolate, and spices a with a slight and piquant aftertaste. A very good beer. Lament that is a summer, since with a bit more of cold would have been excellent.

Has a amber color, very turbid. Very few head. The aroma is sweet, with some species in the fund, probably some another vegetable. The good body. The flavor is sweet, much caramel and berries. The finish is good, not too sweet or bitter, with an agreeable aftertaste.

Has a light yellow color, with a white and frothy head, almost without cord. The aroma is to masses and yeast. The flavor is dry, with notes of grain, wheat. Also there is something of fruits, maybe apples. An average, decent body. Nothing special.

The aroma is strong and good, fruits and masses. Has a golden aspect, with a white thin, tight head, the cord is small. The excellent mouthfeel, scarcely feels, well. Interesting, a bit piquant, but sweet flavor at the same time. Has a flavor to fresh fruits. Well.
beer_name: Samuel Smiths Organic Best Ale / Organically Produced Ale

review_blob: Has a very dark black color, with a bronzed and very small head. The aroma is of nut, the caramel, and the sweet coffee. It is strong and good. The flavor does not fulfill the expectations of the aroma. It is a weak flavor, with some characteristics of coffee, but weak. has before other porter better.
Dark Golden color, with few foam and very rapid. It does not have aroma. The taste is to sugar burnt, bad. not  commentaries more.
In can. Has a yellowish color, with a white, abundant, but rapid head. Has something from taste to herbs, very slightly. A light beer of the average.

Has a yellow very pale color, with abundant white foam. The aroma is soft and weak, that reminds something of herbs. The flavor is known, looks like greatly the industrial beers of Chile. Has the weak and watery body. The truth that with a lot of heat, is good.

Amber color, almost bronze. White foam, not great. The aroma is to dried fruits.
In the palate the candy is deep and has bitterness small. The finish is rather tart, but decent. Nice.

Golden clear, transparent color. With great white foam.
Sweet aroma. In the palate is sweet to the beginning, but his little body makes it very alcoholic. has too much caramel.
Sweet aroma, which reminds wild berries. The only thing. little foams, without body. In the fund the flavor reminds something to the coffee. is astringent.
Has a golden clear color with great foam. has an aroma to sweet, very strong, too much. It does not have body. is a bit insipid. Badly.

Has a slight aroma to peaches and a blond bronze color, very turbid. is very frothy, has too much gas. The flavor is sweet, almost insipid. It does not have body. The finish is bitter and wrong, is an insipid beer.

Aroma to candy and cherries, very perceptible and very agreeable. Has a dark brown color, with an abundant and yellowish foam. In the palate is well malty, with many prevalence of coffee. The finish is rather sweet, too much. The body is average, soft. Nice

Almost without aroma, very subtle a slight malty appears. Has bronze color, and amber, very turbid, with abundant foam and a marvellous cord. The small peaches, sweets and acids prevail over a subtle malty. Has a marvellous body, I am surprised. Very good.

Aroma to candy and fresh small peaches. Has bronze color, darkly, with red lights. The foam is abundant, rapid, almost without cord. The body is weak and thin. The first sip is good, with one I leave sour fruit-juice. There is no bitterness, there is little hop.

Is a beer of dark brown color, with a big and beige head, very lasting. The aroma is with chocolate and cinnamon. The flavor is with toasted malts and some hoppy, but there happens the typical of the Chilean mrcrobreweries, the caramel is tart. In addition I notice something metallic in the palate. The body and the texture are average. Not beyond the common.

Has a cloudy amber color, with a big and abundant head. 
The aroma is to fruits, with herbs and acid notes. The flavor is soft, with a beginning of herbs and hops, fresh.. But having ended there stays a dry, bitter aftertaste. Not special at all.
Little, very little aroma. Has too much gas, much. The taste is rather tart. This does know anything!. is like to take a black potion. Bad.
beer_name: Volcanes del Sur Premium Bock Negra

review_blob: Has a intense aroma to chocolate. The color is very dark, almost black. The foam is abundant and has a magnificent cord. The beginning is very good, there is perceived the malty and the chocolate, which is very abundant. Chocolate, chocolate, too much chocolate.
beer_name: Volcanes del Sur Premium Bock Chocolate

review_blob:
Has a golden color, colored with lights  of bronze color. In the aroma there are subtle malts, but predominate the herbs and the hop.
In the palate is hoppynesses, with something of malty, and an end of caramel .
Has a soft texture and an average body. Very easy to drink. Undoubtedly, is the best Chilean pilsner.

Has a golden pure color, is very frothy and with much gas. The aroma is good leavening and bread.  In paladar is sweet, with a fine bitterness, very nice. A very good equation of Malt and hop. The finish, perhaps, is very bitter, but is pleasant. is smooth and with an average body. Very good beer. Congratulations.

Has a reddish color, amber. The head is very white and persistent. The aroma is exquisite, raspberries. (The aroma is of an intense freshness). The flavor is balanced, surprisingly. Is well malty, but the raspberry is persistent, very well. The best mixing (raddler) that I have tried of the Chilean beer of microbreweries.
The aroma is strong, probably a bit mellow. Has a rather dark foam, with very little cord. In the palate is very wrong. (I will try again).

Aroma to honey, very agreeable, soft, recomforting sweet. Is gaseous, with great foams, almost without cord. Very rapid. In the palate is sweet initially, with something acid ultimately. Has a slight body, though agreeable. I believe that it is another good attempt. Probably if was a bit less alcoholic, would be a marvellous beer.
